program_name: Ameren Missouri Demand Response Program (Delivered by Enel North America)
description: Ameren Missouri's Demand Response Program enables commercial and industrial customers to earn cash incentives by reducing nonessential energy use when the grid needs it most. The program is managed exclusively by Enel North America (formerly Enel X) under a 100 MW agreement covering the 2019-2021+ program period. This utility-aggregator partnership recruits C&I participants across Missouri's MISO territory, helping reduce peak demand on Ameren's distribution network and providing additional resources to the MISO transmission system. Ameren Missouri invests $51 million annually in 2025-2026 and $22 million in 2027 toward demand response programs.

service_territories: Ameren Missouri service territory in eastern Missouri (MISO Zone 5)

customer_classes.size_threshold_notes: Commercial and industrial Ameren Missouri customers including manufacturers, schools, data centers, cold storage facilities can participate. Minimum load reduction capability not explicitly specified but aggregator-managed program suggests flexibility for various customer sizes.

capacity_rate.notes: Customers earn cash incentives for participation. Specific rates not publicly disclosed - managed through Enel aggregator contracts. Program linked to MISO LMR capacity market, so participants benefit from MISO capacity auction clearing prices.

performance_rate.notes: Performance payments structure not publicly disclosed. Enel manages all participation aspects including energy savings plans and event dispatch.

penalty_structure.penalty_description: Penalty structure not publicly disclosed. Aggregator manages performance obligations.

nomination_bidding.nomination_deadline: Ongoing enrollment through Enel North America
nomination_bidding.bidding_structure: Aggregator-managed program. Enel handles all MISO market bidding and coordination. Customers receive fixed incentive payments based on contracted rates.

special_attributes: Exclusive agreement with Enel North America as aggregator
100 MW portfolio managed by Enel for 2019-2021+ period
Enel manages participation from start to finish including customer recruitment
Program provides more stable alternative to fluctuating MISO LMR program
Helps reduce peak demand on Ameren distribution network and MISO transmission system
Opinion Dynamics provides evaluation and guidance for program optimization
Part of Ameren Missouri's MEEIA (Missouri Energy Efficiency Investment Act) portfolio
$51 million annual investment in DR and EE programs for 2025-2026
$22 million annual investment in DR programs for 2027

program_evolution.change_description: Enel X signed exclusive 100 MW demand response agreement with Ameren Missouri for 2019-2021 program period
Ameren Missouri launched multiyear cost-saving programs with $51 million annual investment in DR and energy efficiency for 2025-2026
Planned $22 million annual investment specifically for demand response programs

integration_metadata.notes: BATTERY SUITABILITY ASSESSMENT: Ameren Missouri's DR program through Enel has MODERATE SUITABILITY for battery energy storage systems with important considerations: POSITIVE FACTORS: (1) Aggregator-managed program removes complexity of direct MISO market participation, (2) Enel is world's largest DR aggregator with extensive battery integration experience, (3) Flexible participation without published minimum MW requirements suggests battery projects of various sizes could qualify, (4) Strong utility commitment ($51M annually 2025-2026, $22M in 2027) indicates program stability, (5) Program tied to MISO LMR capacity market benefits from high Missouri Zone 5 clearing prices ($719.81/MW-day Fall/Spring 2024-2025), (6) Enel manages all energy savings plans and dispatch coordination reducing operational burden. LIMITING FACTORS: (1) Exclusive aggregator relationship means must work through Enel - no direct utility contracts, (2) Payment rates not publicly disclosed - must negotiate directly with Enel, (3) Event parameters and response requirements not publicly detailed, (4) Aggregated portfolio approach may limit individual project revenue visibility, (5) Program appears focused on traditional C&I load curtailment (HVAC, lighting, production) - battery integration may require customized approach. RECOMMENDATION: Battery developers in Ameren Missouri territory should contact Enel North America directly to discuss participation terms. Best suited for behind-the-meter commercial batteries (schools, data centers, cold storage) where battery can supplement building load curtailment. Stand-alone battery projects may find direct MISO ESR or LMR participation more transparent and potentially more lucrative. DATA QUALITY NOTE: Score of 6.5/10 reflects limited public information on specific payment rates, event parameters, and battery-specific eligibility. Direct contact with Enel required for comprehensive evaluation.
